intro: Gnaphalium bellidioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of numerous small florets. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in summer, and its foliage is typically narrow and linear. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant is also known for its aromatic leaves and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
